definition: to do/to manage/to handle/to play with/to fool with/to mess with/to fix/to toy with
bad/spoiled/broken/to break down/(suffix) to the utmost

sentences.english: A: Sorry. I broke your radio.
sentences.chinese: 對不起，我把你的收音機弄壞了。

sentences.english: Mikaela: I'm sorry. I'm so sorry about your eye.
sentences.chinese: 對不起，抱歉弄壞你的眼睛。

sentences.english: The intruder broke down the door.
I feel so regretful; I have damaged your favorite bag.
sentences.chinese: 我真是很後悔，把你最喜歡的包給弄壞了。

sentences.english: You will break the TV if you don't stop monkeying about with it.
sentences.chinese: 你這樣瞎弄，要把電視機弄壞的。

sentences.english: The gentleman gnashed his teeth when he saw the damage to his new car.
sentences.chinese: 那位先生看到他的新車被弄壞了，氣得咬牙切齒。

sentences.english: Don't damage these ancient books;I shall not be able to replace them.
sentences.chinese: 別把這些古書弄壞了，我可賠不起。

sentences.english: The pupil bent the corners of the pages in and damage them.
sentences.chinese: 這名小學生把頁角向內折，弄壞了書頁。

sentences.english: The child has bust up the alarm clock.
The boy bent the book back and damaged it.
sentences.chinese: 這男孩把書往後卷，把書弄壞了。

sentences.english: M: She messed up the TV she borrowed? You don't need a roommate like her.
sentences.chinese: 她就是那樣的人，上回她把借來的電視機給弄壞了。

sentences.english: If he had not broken his tooth， he would not be in hospital now.
sentences.chinese: 假如他沒有把牙齒弄壞，現在就不在醫院了。

sentences.english: The faulty lawn mower chewed the grass up.
sentences.chinese: 那臺有毛病的割草機把草坪弄壞了。

sentences.english: I fear that I've broken your pen.
sentences.chinese: 只怕我已經弄壞你的筆了。

sentences.english: John strained his eyes by reading too much small print.
sentences.chinese: 約翰因看過多的小字體而弄壞了眼睛。

sentences.english: The chair (which /that) you broke yesterday is now being repaired.
sentences.chinese: 你昨天弄壞的那把椅子現在正在修理。
